page.title: 15Architectural Heritage 2
page.content: The Court House: Dating from l4OO, this house was completely renovated in l93l. It contains a window dating back to the Norman Conquest. The pigeon loft has housing for l,OOO birds. Friends' Bungalow: Used as the Meeting House from l656 until l7l7. It was then used as a Quaker School. The house is now used to rent, with the two cottages next door, always to Quakers. Little Load Dairy: Dating back to Tudor period this house is built on the site of the oldest agricultural settlement in the area. Long Load Bridge: dating from the l5th Century it is built on the site of a Roman Bridge, and is listed.
